channel.title: Sending Javascript commands in java, Possible? lol
channel.description:
I am looking for a little bit of assistance here. What I am constructing is just an account generation application in java for RS2. What I noticed is if you connect to [url=https://create.runescape.com/lang/en/aff/runescape/index.html]https://create.runescape.com/lang/en/aff/runescape/index.html[/url] versus going through the website you are allowed to run Javascript commands through your addressbar directly to that ..frame? On the other hand if you click Create Account and continue on I couldnt send the commands. I believed this to be because it was sending the command to a parent frame instead of the child that was intended.
So to get to the point, my basic question is can javascript commands be sent via java? I would think so but I have yet to find a way. Next to the plate, what I attempted was opening a new connection the the creation page and would use setRequestProperty to attempt the javasript commands in application to the established connection. Well to no surprise of mine, it failed so I am hoping for and willing to take any suggestions. Thanks :)

item.title: Sending Javascript commands in java, Possible? lol
item.dc:creator: @Portal Portal
item.description:
@Portal wrote:

Well I submitted to defeat mopar. I really wanted to do it this way just to see if I could do it; at my level of knowledge now, I obviously can’t. Therefore, I just decided to send the information in all at once, what I am curious about is why they dont even want the age information if they make you click it in their “breadcrumbstep”. Anyways, thanks for the help, now I just need to setup some checks and randomization. See ya around maybe in the irc.

item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Portal:

Never made it in vb but I can put it in terms of vb better lol, but yes I am.

There are much easier ways to make accounts than what you are trying to do in java, but in order to execute javascript code you would need to use a package to do that, my advice is to look for easier ways of doing this. (like using jagex’s code)

item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“Iamadam, post:5, topic:50458”][quote author=lawl link=topic=70856.msg805629#msg805629 date=1169460565]
mopar^^ isnt that only when you are using an applet?
[/quote]
As far as I am aware, yes. I do believe the runescape client makes use of the JSObject class.[/quote]

They do, that is what made me do some research on it

@Portal, so you are trying to do the same thing in java like you did with that little vb program?

item.source: Sending Javascript commands in java, Possible? lol

item.title: Sending Javascript commands in java, Possible? lol
item.dc:creator: @Portal Portal
item.description:
@Portal wrote:

Hey mopar thanks for the links they were good references. I think I might be able to accomplish my goal with the netscape package by getting the members of the page and then setting them <3. Ill let you know how things go when I test it, which will probably be tomorrow after work.

Edit: Did the research and re-read your response and after attempting to use this, I quicly realized it would not do what I need it to. To show an example of what I am doing, check out this link https://create.runescape.com/lang/en/aff/runescape/index.html

and in the url box enter this and go:

javascript:void(document.getElementsByTagName('option')[3].selected=true)

This will simply select the third element in the drop down box. Hopefully this clears things up about how I am trying to run the javascript code. In terms of VisualBasic I would pretty much just use

browser.Navigate "https://create.runescape.com/lang/en/aff/runescape/index.html" ...lil sleep until load complete browser.Navigate "javascript:void(document.getElementsByTagName('option')[3].selected=true)"

Hope for some more suggestions Thanks

Read full topic
item.source: Sending Javascript commands in java, Possible? lol

item.title: Sending Javascript commands in java, Possible? lol
item.dc:creator: @Iamadam Iamadam
item.description:
@Iamadam wrote:

On another topic

mopar^^ isnt that only when you are using an applet?

As far as I am aware, yes. I do believe the runescape client makes use of the JSObject class.

Read full topic
item.source: Sending Javascript commands in java, Possible? lol

item.title: Sending Javascript commands in java, Possible? lol
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

It is entirely possible through the netscape package included with java. Javascript can call methods and change variables in a java applet, and a java applet can call methods and change variables in javascript provided they are ran on the same page. I found alot of info for this on google not too long ago, I will try to dig up the links for you again.

edit:

http://java.sun.com/products/plugin/1.3/docs/jsobject.html
http://www.codeproject.com/jscript/javatojs.asp?df=100&forumid=736&exp=0&select=119638

I got those from: http://www.google.com/search?q=javascript+communicating+with+applet

Good luck on whatever you are doing.

Read full topic
